item.title: Using the Latest LLVM Release on MacOS
item.description: MacOS is really frustrating with how it handles its libraries and compilers. It is also frustrating because it ships an unspecified version of LLVM, which generally isn't the latest stable release. You can, however, with a little tweaking, use the latest version of LLVM or GCC on your Mac, and reliably use it for your C and C++ tooling. Installation First, you need to install the latest version of LLVM. Most people nowadays are using Homebrew.
